headline: Bernie Sanders compares climate change to Pearl Harbor
subHeadline: Democratic presidential candidate Bernie Sanders teams with Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez to call for a massive mobilization of federal resources to deal with climate change.

utterances.sentences: A public spat with President Trump leaves Britain's ambassador to the U.S. to step down. The fallout, that's ahead.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Welcome back. After creating a diplomatic firestorm, the British ambassador, the man who criticized President Trump, has resigned. Leaked cable shows the diplomat calling the Trump administration, quote, diplomatically clumsy and inapt, end quote. President Trump firing back on twitter yesterday, he said this in part, quote, the wacky ambassador that the U.K. foisted on the United States is not someone we are thrilled with, a very stupid guy. Trump then added, I don't know the ambassador, but have been told he's a pompous fool. Jesse, what are you hearing?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I mean, the ambassador's observations sound like Chuck Todd. It's like anybody can watch MSNBC and come away with the same exact things that they say on cable as the ambassador said about Trump. The guy is chaotic, he's sensitive, and he's up ending the world order. It doesn't seem like the ambassador had any sort of special insight or was plumbed in that well with the Trump White House. I mean, with that said, I understand what he's saying. He's a Britain first guy. He's concerned that Trump's approach is America first. And the president is obviously reasserting American dominance in trade and security arrangement and that's upsetting a lot of other countries. But he also had a lot of other great observation such as, if you want to get through to Trump, speak bluntly. Make a personal phone call. And his energy at his rallies were really, really powerful. And he seems to be a political survivalist. I think one analogy was he was like -- was it like Arnold Schwarzenegger in the Terminator at the end of the movie when he walks out of the fire surviving.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, is that what happened?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's right.

Here's Bernie Sanders ramping up the climate hysteria with this comparison.

utterances.speaker: SEN. BERNIE SANDERS, I-VT, D-PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: I'm reminded today in terms of the crisis that we face in climate change about where the United States was 1941 when it was attacked at Pearl Harbor. And what happened at that point having to fight a war on two fronts at the East and in Europe. The United States came together and within three years, it had created the type of armaments program that was necessary to in fact win the war.

So, he has got to figure out a way to have some relevance. And if I were Elizabeth Warren, I might just want AOC to go to Bernie, right. I wouldn't want that endorsement like let him have that, because it is not working out that well for Bernie this time around.

utterances.sentences: No, I said that a while ago that if you get AOC's endorsement, you own that craziness or whatever that she might say that day that's idiotic or irrational or whatever. utterances.sentences: Before I address that. Kudos to Bernie Sanders comparing climate change to Pearl Harbor is an improvement. So, maybe they're learning to choose other things. But Pearl Harbor is still pretty bad. Fear is the quickest way to get to your pocketbook and they take an issue and they make taxation the only solution. To your point, their demands when you're talking about gasoline can only be endured by the white rich. Let's face it. It's a white liberal rich, the Tom Steyer's of the world that can endure these climate change restrictions, but it's going to harm the lives of minorities. Right. This is the most anti-minority issue, blue collar Americans as well. You're talking about eliminating jobs, restricting modes of transportation, increasing prices on basic living needs like gasoline. These are things that rich white people can just shrug off and go and then feel really good about the fact that they have a Tesla and they could feel really good that they have solar panels, because it's totally affordable to them and then everybody else is like--

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.sentences: They get discounts.

utterances.sentences: I'll tell you what you could go with me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.sentences: You've already helped pay for the privilege because of all the tax credits they've got, the tax breaks.

utterances.sentences: Is that what it is? This is like double jeopardy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Unbelievable.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But anyway, I think that you guys are right about Bernie. You know I don't think we're talking about him. I don't think that he is moving ahead in this campaign, but I just think that this is to me sounding the alarm. I think when you have 90 degrees in Alaska this summer and you have hail in Guadalajara in Mexico, I think people think something is going on. Flooding of the crops--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But you can reverse that Juan like - you laugh at people. You laugh at Republicans who say, oh! it's so cold. Thanks, global warming. It's the same thing. You can't play both sides.

utterances.sentences: Something is going on.

utterances.sentences: Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS

The Democrats use death to motivate. They say, you know they're going to throw granny over the cliff. Tax cuts kill you. Police kill you. Capitalism kills you. You know the weather is a kamikaze pilot. By the way, Bernie should apologize to the Japanese very insensitive analogy comparing climate change to Pearl Harbor. I think he owes them an apology.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS

utterances.sentences: Something is going on. That's what we know.

utterances.sentences: That's terrifying video of a Delta plane engine falling apart and catching fire mid-flight. Passengers heard a loud boom before smoke filled the cabin. Luckily, no one was hurt after the plane was forced to make an emergency landing. Delta apologized of course for the inconvenience. My goodness, Dagen what would you do? Would you cry?

utterances.sentences: That was sexist.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Yes, I would.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I would cry.

utterances.sentences: And I had to sit on a Delta flight once next to somebody with a raging staph infection that was visible all over his body. And I got nothing. Nothing.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: More mean. More mean, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Who thought this guy had any potential? He -- I mean, Swalwell looks like Churchill compared to this guy.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Indeed, and he's better looking. Swalwell is not in it anymore. I'll give him that. So, he's going to fight racial inequality in this country starting with a Vanity Fair cover, and then his follow-up was a -- that story in the New Yorker, which basically no one reads and just tells everybody else that they read it, can Beto bounce back?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I love that. So you can't practice identity politics if you have no personal identity, and he doesn't. You can see the thought bubble over his head. When am I going to do when I'm done with this? Maybe I'll become a dentist. Maybe I'll learn how to use a loom and make some alpaca throws and sell them on Etsy. He is a nobody, and he is a nothing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He's the Etsy candidate. So, Juan, I came up with a phrase I think you'll like. I call it woke shrinkage.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's like if you continue to smear everybody as un-woke and oppressors, you just narrowed your party until no one is around you. I call that woke shrinkage. I think that's pretty clever.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I thought you were saying that you thought it was sort of this political expedience that he was saying this. And he was trying to, in fact, you know, rejuvenate his candidacy, which is what you're saying in the New Yorker piece was about, right?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But, let me just say, I don't think there's any debate that what he said is true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes, there is.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yeah --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Our country was not founded on white supremacy. I would disagree.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I wouldn't because I would say the founders reserve the franchise, the voting franchise for landowning white males. I think that was it. In other words, Dagen and Dana couldn't vote. I know, I couldn't --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So was it founded on sexism, too, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I don't even think -- did you own land? I don't think you already --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So it was founded on sexism, too, wasn't it?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, yeah --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Pile it all on now, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no, I'm not piling it on. I mean, in other words, Jesse, to say this is a historical fact -- I'm just saying, that's the fact.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Barack Obama didn't even say that about our --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'm just telling you --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Barack Obama said the most beautiful, inspiring things about this nation's founding. He didn't get anywhere close to what you said or Beto O'Rourke said. But any person who's going to run for president of this country never would say something like that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think anybody who knows American history would say, OK, so that's reality. The question is --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't think anybody agrees with that, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wait, how can you disagree with the idea that America -- that the Founding Fathers said you've got to be a landowning white male to vote.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Just because something happened at the time doesn't define the founding.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No -- what are you talking about?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Just because people had slaves during the founding doesn't mean we were founded on slavery and white supremacy.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I just think that's a fact of our American being, and --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, it's a fact, it's a flaw. It doesn't define the founding.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Of course it defines --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, it does not.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I want to get Dana in.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Hang on, let me just finish this point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think the left sees this and I think Beto O'Rourke is reflecting that and he says let's fix it. Let's do something about --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think the right, like you, refuses to even say, oh, yeah, you know what, that's part of the original --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I said -- I acknowledged that there was slavery at the beginning of the founding of this country. I acknowledged that women or black Americans didn't have certain rights. But, Juan, we fought -- 600,000 people died in the civil war to eradicate it. He said every institution in this country is racist? The military, the media, the justice system, the culture, everything is racist, Juan? You don't agree with that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Are you kidding? The military is our leading example of diversity --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You're saying every single institution in this country you think is racist?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No. But, Jesse, even the military --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, kids -- kids, am I going to have to separate you two? We can't ever talk about race anymore, can we?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We can't. I'm going to change the topic just a little bit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Jasper?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He's my black brother.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He's brown.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He's brown. He's my brown brother.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think Beto O'Rourke is the only one who doesn't know that his campaign is over.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, he's like Bruce Willis in The Sixth Sense.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. I never saw --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't want to spoil it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Does that have a weird ending?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Does it have a weird ending. You didn't see it?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think -- I don't remember.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You don't remember the ending of The Sixth Sense? It's kind of the whole point of the movie is the ending. Do you remember the ending of The Titanic?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The ship doesn't make it through.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And The Sixth Sense doesn't?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, no. Jaws, about a shark.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, OK.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's kind of supernatural.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Anyway. I think if he keeps going, he's going to ruin his future opportunity to run for other political offices.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, that's a good little piece of advised from Dana Perino. So in The Sixth Sense, what happens is -- no, I can't do that because there's people watching that never seen the movie.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, come on. That's an old movie. You can do it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, he was dead all along.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I see dead people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Including the Founding Fathers.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We tried so hard with you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A public spat with -- you get so angry about race and then we're just laughing --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A public spat with President Trump leaves Britain's ambassador to the U.S. to step down. The fallout, that's ahead.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. After creating a diplomatic firestorm, the British ambassador, the man who criticized President Trump, has resigned. Leaked cable shows the diplomat calling the Trump administration, quote, diplomatically clumsy and inapt, end quote. President Trump firing back on twitter yesterday, he said this in part, quote, the wacky ambassador that the U.K. foisted on the United States is not someone we are thrilled with, a very stupid guy. Trump then added, I don't know the ambassador, but have been told he's a pompous fool. Jesse, what are you hearing?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I mean, the ambassador's observations sound like Chuck Todd. It's like anybody can watch MSNBC and come away with the same exact things that they say on cable as the ambassador said about Trump. The guy is chaotic, he's sensitive, and he's up ending the world order. It doesn't seem like the ambassador had any sort of special insight or was plumbed in that well with the Trump White House. I mean, with that said, I understand what he's saying. He's a Britain first guy. He's concerned that Trump's approach is America first. And the president is obviously reasserting American dominance in trade and security arrangement and that's upsetting a lot of other countries. But he also had a lot of other great observation such as, if you want to get through to Trump, speak bluntly. Make a personal phone call. And his energy at his rallies were really, really powerful. And he seems to be a political survivalist. I think one analogy was he was like -- was it like Arnold Schwarzenegger in the Terminator at the end of the movie when he walks out of the fire surviving.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, is that what happened?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Did we just spoil another movie?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And he sees dead people.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And he sees dead people. Dagen, you know, just to get the reality of it is, given that he -- these memos were leaked and he antagonized President Trump, did he have any choice but to resign? What good could he be as a diplomat to the United States?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Oh, excuse -- we should say -- we have to call him sir. He's a sir. We're better than they are. We're bigger than they are. He's got to go. Don't rip on our president, period. And his biggest --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You don't think that our ambassador say things like this about world leaders? I read that happen to President Obama when all those cables leaked -- embarrass around the world.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I mean, you've got to go. But I want to point out that Boris Johnson who's, you know, the front runner to become the prime minister, declined to back Darroch, or however you want to see his name. He's not French. Or say that he would keep him on board, and said calling him a superb diplomat. But, again -- and then he said whoever leaked the document has done a great disservice to our civil service, but he didn't stand up for the guy. And so, that certainly didn't help him.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, in fact, then the thought, Dana, is that maybe Nigel Farage, who was Trump's pick to be the ambassador, originally, that maybe Boris Johnson would put him in. Although, Jeremy Hunt who is the other conservative in Britain, has been much more supportive of Darroch, and said that guy is an excellent ambassador and was a former national security advisor in Britain.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Either way, what -- I think that we should be concerned that our greatest ally can't keep a secret, right? So we're sharing a lot of secrets with them. We rely on each other to help protect the world. And if they can't even keep their -- these secret memos away from the public, and that's a serious problem. That's the same what the United States had to do when all those documents leaked after Ed Snowden fled the coop and he headed to Russia. Like, that is a major, major breach. And if you cannot be candid to -- back to your home country, that is a -- it's a huge problem. So I think that that's where their focus should be. Their politics will sort itself out in Britain.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Greg, you know, one of the interesting --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's Sir Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Sir Greg --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's my safe word.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Sir Gregory, how about that? Is that OK, Greg? Sir Gregory, do you think that this is really about British politics, that one side is leaking on the other in the midst of the upcoming election?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, I was -- first thing about the leaking is -- what are the chances -- this guy was planning on leaving anyway, right? Wasn't he on his way out? I think he was.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Likely, I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: End of the year.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: End of the year. So, I think maybe that he might have just leaked it, because that's what he was going to do.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Nobody wants to be professionally embarrassed like that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know, maybe he thought it would be cool. People do strange things, Dana as if you know. Anyway, but here's what - here's the thing that I find most entertaining were the people that were sick. People that were upset about this. Like George Conway, you know him. Married to Kellyanne. We're saying, oh! my god, everybody likes this guy. He's a good guy. The parties at the embassy were great.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, on the one side, there is Trump, on the other there are people who are desperate to preserve their cocktail party status. You know, oh! god, I'm going to lose my free champagne and gluten (ph). And I used to watch the fireworks on the rooftop of the embassy. That'll never happen, because Trump is the skunk at the garden party. These - like the people that were upset, were upset because they threw great parties and the diplomat was such a nice guy and you could do me favors Trump doesn't give a crap about that. That's what I like.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I think that's partly true. But I will say that for to be a diplomat in Washington these days, the diplomats all say, they don't have any idea what's going on. They can't predict Trump because--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Isn't that great?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, no, but if you go to the State Department.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Which is normally the way you would do it, right, or you go to Treasury or you go to any of the agencies, they say we can't tell you anything, even militarily.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We can't tell you about pullouts or anything. You've got to just talk to Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And everything is working awesome.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh! Is that right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OK. All right.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: He got elected to drain the swamp, one swamp denizen out of here.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right. So much for allies. Bernie Sanders and Alexandra Ocasio Cortez, they're teaming up to declare war on climate change. Those details to catch your attention next on “The Five.”

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Burn baby burn.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Socialist Bernie Sanders and Alexandra Ocasio-Cortez teaming up yet again to push their Left-wing agenda. This time they're demanding that the government declare climate change, a national emergency and they're calling for a massive mobilization of federal resources to deal with it. Here's Bernie Sanders ramping up the climate hysteria with this comparison.

utterances.speaker: SEN. BERNIE SANDERS, I-VT, D-PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: I'm reminded today in terms of the crisis that we face in climate change about where the United States was 1941 when it was attacked at Pearl Harbor. And what happened at that point having to fight a war on two fronts at the East and in Europe. The United States came together and within three years, it had created the type of armaments program that was necessary to in fact win the war.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Drive me crazy.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Dana. Win the war. Right, Pearl Harbor.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't know. Look, you know why he wants Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez to help him because he absolutely needs her. His campaign is almost invisible. It's amazing. You think about the debates. Nobody talked about him in the debates. Nobody has talked about him since. He had a pretty good fundraising number. Nobody even talked about that. So, he has got to figure out a way to have some relevance. And if I were Elizabeth Warren, I might just want AOC to go to Bernie, right. I wouldn't want that endorsement like let him have that, because it is not working out that well for Bernie this time around.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: No, I said that a while ago that if you get AOC's endorsement, you own that craziness or whatever that she might say that day that's idiotic or irrational or whatever. But Greg, how do you run on, I'm going to fight climate change, because these candidates essentially are telling the American people, your gasoline is going to be $6, $7, $8 a gallon. We're going to tell you what kind of car to drive and you might actually lose your job if you work even anywhere near the energy industry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Before I address that. Kudos to Bernie Sanders comparing climate change to Pearl Harbor is an improvement. He didn't say the Holocaust, which has been the usual go-to analogy for the Far Left. Whenever something is bad, it's like Hitler or it's the Holocaust. So, maybe they're learning to choose other things. But Pearl Harbor is still pretty bad. Fear is the quickest way to get to your pocketbook and they take an issue and they make taxation the only solution. To your point, their demands when you're talking about gasoline can only be endured by the white rich. Let's face it. It's a white liberal rich, the Tom Steyer's of the world that can endure these climate change restrictions, but it's going to harm the lives of minorities. Right. This is the most anti-minority issue, blue collar Americans as well. You're talking about eliminating jobs, restricting modes of transportation, increasing prices on basic living needs like gasoline. These are things that rich white people can just shrug off and go and then feel really good about the fact that they have a Tesla and they could feel really good that they have solar panels, because it's totally affordable to them and then everybody else is like--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They bought an offset.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Carbon offsets.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They bought carbon offsets. That's it for me.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wait a second. I love this show because I learn about white privilege from Greg. So, is that right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It is. That's the white privilege.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: If I was white, I'd get a Tesla?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Can you believe this, Dagen.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, they get discounts, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: They get discounts.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They get discounts.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Nobody told me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know, I know a dealer. Or Tesla's too.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'll tell you what you could go with me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You've already helped pay for the privilege because of all the tax credits they've got, the tax breaks.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Is that what it is? This is like double jeopardy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Unbelievable.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But anyway, I think that you guys are right about Bernie. You know I don't think we're talking about him. I don't think that he is moving ahead in this campaign, but I just think that this is to me sounding the alarm. I think when you have 90 degrees in Alaska this summer and you have hail in Guadalajara in Mexico, I think people think something is going on. Flooding of the crops--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But you can reverse that Juan like - you laugh at people. You laugh at Republicans who say, oh! it's so cold. Thanks, global warming. It's the same thing. You can't play both sides.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I'm just saying, something is going on with - I just think OK, if you guys don't want--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Something is going on.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Something is going on. When you see 90 degrees in Alaska?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I thought weather had nothing to do with climate change.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It does have something to do with it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They're not going to do a climate change.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think they're sounding the alarm. I don't think there is much of a price to pay for it in terms of the Democratic primary process. I do think it's a very proactive talking point for Bernie. He's going to take it out on the campaign trail, and it will resonate.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Listen Juan, it's OK to sound the alarm.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But then when you say, everyone is going to die if you don't give me all of your money, that's not sounding the alarm. That's a fear tactic. But they do this all the time. The Democrats use death to motivate. They say, you know they're going to throw granny over the cliff. Tax cuts kill you. Police kill you. Capitalism kills you. You know the weather is a kamikaze pilot. By the way, Bernie should apologize to the Japanese very insensitive analogy comparing climate change to Pearl Harbor. I think he owes them an apology.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I'm just glad Juan didn't say--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Very sensitive to these issues.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: He's just starting a conversation because my head would have exploded. WILLIAMS: Well, I didn't do that to you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Something is going on. That's what we know.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's what I say. Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Terrifying video coming up of a plane engine falling apart mid- flight, a highway cash grab and a hilarious way that we came up with our own 2020 campaign slogans. It's all in Fastest 7.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. Time for the Fastest 7. First up, talk about a scare in the air.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's terrifying video of a Delta plane engine falling apart and catching fire mid-flight. Passengers heard a loud boom before smoke filled the cabin. Luckily, no one was hurt after the plane was forced to make an emergency landing. Delta apologized of course for the inconvenience. My goodness, Dagen what would you do? Would you cry?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That was sexist.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Yes, I would.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I would cry.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Everybody - you're freaking out when this is happening. But Delta gets an F minus for its response. I think they gave people $30 food vouchers--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's it?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: And I had to sit on a Delta flight once next to somebody with a raging staph infection that was visible all over his body. And I got nothing. Nothing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Not even 30 bucks to eat.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I was going to say, I mean looking at that, list of the things that I don't like to look at on planes, other people's bare hairy toes and sandals.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's the worst.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Some guy carrying his big lunch, he just got at the Terminal Six Chipotle.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And a skittish lady with her therapy pair ferret or parrots. A jet imploding outside your window comes in number four.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I would agree though to Greg's point, no flip flops on the flight.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Close.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's got to be close.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Unless you have sexy toes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No one does.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Lou Dobbs.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, you've never seen mine. Juan? Does this scare you?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I've never seen your toes. You're talking about this plane.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.
